discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Certain types of files, such as Bitmap (.bmp) or MP3 (.mp3) files, don't contain content that can be indexed. As a result, the search indexing servers in Exchange and SharePoint don't perform full-text indexing on these types of files. These types of files are considered to be unsupported file types. 

Source: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/ediscovery-partially-indexed-items-in-content-search?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: D
D - correct.
BMP file is not indexed so it is same as not supported.

Selected Answer: B
B - correct.
Communication compliance. Please note that this feature requires users to have E5 license.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 tenant.
You plan to deploy a monitoring solution that meets the following requirements:
✑ Captures Microsoft Teams channel messages that contain threatening or violent language
✑ Alerts a reviewer when a threatening or violent message is identified
What should you include in the solution?

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You need to identify which administrative users performed eDiscovery searches during the past week.
What should you do from the Microsoft 365 compliance center?

discussion.content: Correct, for E5 licenses you have one year

comments.content: Yeah sure, that's why we're using ET instead of the official practice tests that give you similar questions instead of actual questions...
Wanna throw money away? be my guest but I usually read the comments and links provided so I know what is what and not just memorizing.

upvote for additional knowledge. 
Remember that we are here for knowledge first and secondly to gain badges/ certs!
For users assigned any other (non-E5) Office 365 or Microsoft 365 license, audit records are retained for 90 days. so the given ans is correct 90 days

discussion.content:
For users assigned any other (non-E5) Office 365 or Microsoft 365 license, audit records are retained for 90 days.
For users assigned an Office 365 E5 or Microsoft 365 E5 license for up to one year

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/search-the-audit-log-in-security-and-compliance?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: D
E3 license has 90 days E5 is a year with an option to extend to 10years
90 days for sure. E5 is needed for more.
Situation states users have E3 license. Correct answer is 90 days.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
All users are assigned a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
You enable auditing for your organization.
What is the maximum amount of time data will be retained in the Microsoft 365 audit log?

HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Intune.
You need to configure Windows Information Protection (WIP).
What should you create, and what should you use to create it? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: The Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center

Create a WIP policy -
1. Sign in to the Microsoft Endpoint Manager.
2. Open Microsoft Intune and select Apps > App protection policies > Create policy.
3. In the App policy screen, select Add a policy, and then fill out the fields:
Name. Type a name (required) for your new policy.
Description. Type an optional description.
Platform. Choose Windows 10.
Enrollment state. Choose Without enrollment for MAM or With enrollment for MDM.
4. Add a mobile app policy.
5. Select Protected apps and then select Add apps.
Box 2: An app protection policies
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/information-protection/windows-information-protection/create-wip-policy-using-intune-azure

discussion.content:
- An app Protection policy 
- The Microsoft Intune Admin Center
Outdated question. Windows Information Protection has been depreciated.
From Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center create device configuration profile.

Can anyone confirm it's still relevant / on exam?
Because:

Starting in July 2022, Microsoft is deprecating Windows Information Protection (WIP). Microsoft will continue to support WIP on supported versions of Windows. New versions of Windows won't include new capabilities for WIP, and it won't be supported in future versions of Windows. For more information, see Announcing sunset of Windows Information Protection.
Correct answers given. Provided link gives both answers.

comments.content: Yes, if the question would still be relevant, the answers provided would be correct. :-)
